intro: Hieracium × kindbergii, commonly known as the hybrid common hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. It produces numerous small, hairy leaves and has a robust root system that allows it to spread easily. Due to its hybrid nature, it exhibits a wide range of morphological variations.
